typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "only the owner can call the confidentialMint() method"

arguments.value: only the owner can call the confidentialMint() method

function (bytes memory) pure returns (bytes memory,bytes memory,address,int256)

nodes.name: confidentialMint

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (bytes memory) pure returns (bytes memory,bytes memory,address,int256)

nodes.documentation:
@dev Executes a basic unilateral, confidential transfer of AZTEC notes adapted for use with 
a mintable ZkAsset.
    * Will submit _proofData to the validateProof() function of the Cryptography Engine. 
    *
If public value is being transferred out of the ACE, and the minted value is greater than 
ACE's token balance, then tokens will be minted from the linked ERC20 token using supplementTokens()
    * Upon successfull verification, it will update note registry state - creating output notes and 
destroying input notes. 

    * @param _proofData - bytes variable outputted from proof construction
nodes.name: confidentialTransfer

nodes.documentation:
@dev Executes a basic unilateral, confidential transfer of AZTEC notes adapted for use with 
a mintable ZkAsset.
    * Will submit _proofData to the validateProof() function of the Cryptography Engine. 
    *
If public value is being transferred out of the ACE, and the minted value is greater than 
ACE's token balance, then tokens will be minted from the linked ERC20 token using supplementTokens()
    * Upon successfull verification, it will update note registry state - creating output notes and 
destroying input notes. 

    * @param _proofData - bytes variable outputted from proof construction
nodes.name: confidentialTransfer

devdoc.author: AZTEC
devdoc.details: A contract defining the standard interface and behaviours of a confidential mintable asset.  Copyright Spilbury Holdings Ltd 2019. All rights reserved.*

confidentialApprove(bytes32,address,bool.details: Note owner approving a third party, another address, to spend the note on  owner's behalf. This is necessary to allow the confidentialTransferFrom() method to be called

params._noteHash: - keccak256 hash of the note coordinates (gamma and sigma)
params._signature: - ECDSA signature from the note owner that validates the confidentialApprove() instruction
params._spender: - address being approved to spend the note
params._status: - defines whether the _spender address is being approved to spend the  note, or if permission is being revoked

confidentialMint(uint24,bytes).details: Executes a confidential minting procedure, dependent on the provided proofData being succesfully validated by the zero-knowledge validator

params._proof: - uint24 variable which acts as a unique identifier for the proof which _proofOutput is being submitted. _proof contains three concatenated uint8 variables:  1) epoch number 2) category number 3) ID number for the proof
params._proofData: - bytes array of proof data, outputted from a proof construction

confidentialTransfer(bytes,bytes).details: Executes a basic unilateral, confidential transfer of AZTEC notes adapted for use with  a mintable ZkAsset.    * Will submit _proofData to the validateProof() function of the Cryptography Engine.     * If public value is being transferred out of the ACE, and the minted value is greater than  ACE's token balance, then tokens will be minted from the linked ERC20 token using supplementTokens()    * Upon successfull verification, it will update note registry state - creating output notes and  destroying input notes.

params._proofData: - bytes variable outputted from proof construction

devdoc.title: ZkAssetMintable
